Posts.Title: Not Doing Well At All! Nanalinda leprechaun

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2010 10:39PM momto2angels wrote: Hi Diane, I know how you feel.  When I was first diagnosed my daughter was 9 and my son.. well.. I was pregnant with him (7 months along).  I had just got my hair to where I could cut it and style it when "it" came back in my liver this past March.  Oh well, I hate having to fiddle with my hair in the morning anyway!  I too chose to go to CTC of America.. love it :)  First thing I did when diagnosed was find stories of survivors who had beat the odds, made it to NED, or were in active treatments and things were going well.  That's all I needed to dust myself off and get ready for all that was ahead of me.. and still is ahead!!  I live every day to the fullest, enjoy every minute with my family.. even if it's a trip to the grocery store!  Take lots of photos.. keep my camera in my purse and journal every night (going over the day's events).  I've been doing that for years but continue to do so because we forget so easily days gone by but just mentioning something you did on any particular day can spark memories.. even beyond what you wrote on paper :)  What a gift to leave any child!!!!  I wish my parents would of done so for me!!  I married my HS sweetheart too :)  We waited forever to get married (24yrs old), forever to have our first child (29yrs old) and forever to have our 2nd child (39yrs old)! lol
Posts.Title: Need Encouragement.... angelsabove Lowrider54

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2012 01:04AM momto2angels wrote: I've kept a diary for years.  Off and on since I was 9.  But mostly "on" since marriage :)  I look back on those pages and am so glad I wrote things down.  I forget so quickly things that happen from day to day.  Photos create memories but to read about them brings them back to life.  I always try to throw in a few video moments when taking photos too.  Again, brings to life the "moment" that has passed.  I have bought a few journal books too.. such as Mother-Tell-Me-Your-Story.  That way the kids can get specifics... when I met their father, my favorite things as a child, etc.  I also bought a Mother-Daughter journal that has allowed my daughter and I to journal together light heartedly.  For instance the right side may be for "daughter".. listing your favorite movies.. then the mother does the same on the left side.  Really a neat journal.  I have bought a few special items with the kids when out and about at specialty shops.  It's always something we as a group will decide upon.  Whether it be a vase, a bowl, etc. (something we can use together.. again.. creating memories).  I will write on the bottom of the item in permanent marker the year and where we purchased the item.  I have a cross wall too that we have purchased crosses for on our family vacations.  Even brought one home from Hawaii. Lots of dancing, singing, funny faces.  The kids will always have the memory of their mom being a big goof from time to time! lol  My daughter and I have been making silly faces in the mirror together since she was little! I had thought about leaving behind gifts for birthdays, videos offering advice for every situation but really I can do that in a journal...  Letting them know what I "hope" for their future and in the meantime teach them to be loving of others and of themselves.  Like someone mentioned above.. death is something of a process.. we all most move on.. move forward.. it's a natural process and really might be best that way.. (without the notes for future dates, etc.)

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2010 06:46AM momto2angels wrote: Has anyone seen this information yet!!!??? This could be "IT"... THE cure! MD Anderson is doing research on this NOW.  NON invasive, no chemo, no surgery and 100% of the cancer cells.. GONE There is a pepsi-fund raiser type of a deal going on right now and you can vote on the website below to help win $250,000 to support ongoing research and clinical trials and to engage 100,000 new donors for cancer research!!! On the pepsi website it states that "In 2010, upon receiving approval from the FDA to build a larger, human-sized device, pre-clinical testing will begin.  The Zanzius Cancer Research Foundation's goal is to begin Phase 1 Human Clinical Trials by 2012.  This is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!  This is our future!  Our children's future!  Please please please read up on it and go to the link below to vote!  www.refresheverything.com/kanziuscancerresearch

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2010 06:38PM momto2angels wrote: That's my fault.. sorry if that bothers people.  I just wanted it to reach everyone.  Not just people in one forum. It's not "hype".  It's "real".  You'll find it's been in research for at least 2 years now and on-going.  It is FDA approved as of NOW and they are starting pre-clinical testing.  It's not something to poo-poo at. I wouldn't of taken the time to post it if I didn't know it was of great importance to "all" of us.
Posts.Title: New treatment in the works momto2angels Member_of_the_Club

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2010 07:35PM momto2angels wrote: I hope it is too.  It really looks promising.  When you get a chance please take a look at the website.. http://www.kanziuscancerresearch.com/ You can watch the program originally aired on 60 minutes a few years back found on Youtube.  Just do a search for kanzius cancer research.  There were a total of 3 parts to that program. The concept was invented by a cancer patient (Mr. Kanzius).  He worked with a cancer/liver specialist at MD Anderson who is still/now heading the research there.  There is research going on in PA too I believe.  It doesn't harm healthy tissue whatsoever :)  They were injecting tumors with metal particles and putting the animal between 2 radio freqency machines.  The metal heated up but only affected the tumor/where the metal was placed.  No other tissue was heated at all.  Somewhere along the line there was a nobel prize winner who came up with nano-particles?  Please don't quote me on all of this.  Just going by what I remember (and I have some chemo-brain going on at this time!!).  So, one of the players (scientist, doctor, inventor) asked for some of those nano-particles so they could combine them with their research.  The concept was to attach these nano-particles/metal to antibodies that target cancer cells.  THEN a human, after given an iv of these metal/nano particles attached to antibodies that target all the cancer cells in their body, would stand between these radio active machines and heat up/destroy EVERY cancer cell!!!  We are already given targeted antibodies.. hercepton would be one example (right?).. so they just need to get these nano particles and antibodies to work together!  Whew.. hope I got all that right.  I just wanted to fill you in a little since you hadn't seen the video or read the research yet.  Hope that helped a little :) What's promising to me is that research has been going on, it "has" progressed "and" the FDA has approved the human sized machine!!!  That's big!  You can read more about it here too "and" vote to help raise $250,000 toward even more research for this amazing find!!!  www.refresheverything.com/kanziuscancerresearch
Posts.Title: MUST READ! MD Anderson & Kanzius Research! momto2angels momto2angels

I'm in the same boat too.  I just found out yesterday.  I was pregnant with my son when I first found my breast cancer.  I was SO sure it was a clogged duct!  Having been through stage 3 for a couple years I can say the best thing I ever did was save stories of survivors on my wordpad.  If I ever got down I would just read those and go on!  You can too!  I just posted last night a thread of "Inspiring Stories".. please read as many as possible, enjoy every moment with your new little one and don't look back.. look "forward" :)
Posts.Title: Liver Mets- what's the prognosis makmak LivingIt

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2010 09:48PM momto2angels wrote: There are some people who feel diet, supplements and exercise help, others who don't.  I'm one of the ones who think it does and so do the naturopathic doctors I see :)  My first oncologist said nothing about diet, exercise and supplements even when asked back in 2007.  That wasn't her field and of course now I understand that she couldn't offer information or tell me what supplements to take.  This time around with mets I got 3 other opinions before settling on Cancer Treatment Centers of America where I have an oncologist but also a naturopath.  Couldn't be happier working with a team who thinks like I do and is there to guide me every step of the way :)  That doesn't mean you need to go to CTCofA in order to get help with diet, supplements and exercise, unless you want everything under one roof :)  Well, not only that but at CTCofA, the oncologists and ND's are on the same page.  You may run across an oncologist (or more) who won't be pleasant about you seeing an ND and who may discourage you from doing so.  Plenty of people have gone out and sought their own naturopathic doctor.  As with any other doctor you will want to find one that you feel comfortable with and offers treatments, etc. that you have heard of, read about, etc... again, feel comfortable with.  For instance, if I saw an ND who told me the only way to get rid of my mets was to stand on my head for 4 hours a day while doing a coffee enima?.. well, yeah, I'd be sure to find someone else! lol  The human body is complex, it react to everything we put in it, and everything we put on it.  Of course there are things that we can put in it and on it that are helpful on this journey.  I say go for it!.. get yourself a great ND!

Posts.Title: Scan and heart results. pee stephanief

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2010 09:08PM momto2angels wrote: I remember the very first radical ND I saw (who also said he would never do chemo) said something like.. really what is the difference between stage 3 and 4.  I was originally diagnosed with stage 3.  His point was, there were always circulating cells and always will be no matter what stage.   I don't know if you can call "any" stage "cured".  Well, how can we when we have stage 0-3 moving on up to stage IV.  I think if we have optimal immune systems along with the help of anti-cancer drugs we can keep it from coming back at "any" stage... right?
